value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays Battle #187: RANKX vs TOPN

value.title: Download/ Export Power Query data to csv, excel or txt - Power BI Tips & Tricks #25
value.excerpt: Do you want to export your power query data? In this video I show you how to do it :)  How to install R: https://goo.gl/g4wbEm BI accountant blog: https://goo.gl/lnjjxM Link to Power BI file: https://gofile.me/2kEOD/YPnFQZQ4c  R script: require(gdata) write.table(trim(dataset), file=”C:/writeyourfilepathhere/filename.txt”,

value.title: Pushing the Power BI buttons 👆
value.excerpt: You haven't missed the Power Bi April 2018 update right?  My favourite feature is by far the new buttons! With Power Bi buttons you can create all kinds of experiences, like buttons to change charts, as I show in this demo.  What is your favourite Power BI april 2018 update? Let me know in the comment

value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX for Power BI - Calculate Cumulative Sum (Running Total) of Count in Power BI
value.excerpt: The cumulative total is also known as Running total and during this video, we will talk about how we can calculate a cumulative sum for request count using Power BI Dax measure in Power BI.  During this session, we will cover the following things: • Real-life example where we need Cumulative Sum 00:21

value.title: Debug DAX using Variables in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Marco Russo, from SQL BI, joins Patrick to look at how you can debug DAX using variables in Power BI. value.title: Easily get an access token for the Power BI Embedded Playground
value.excerpt: You need an Embed Token for the Power BI Embedded Playground, but you don't want to write code. Adam shows you how to easily get an access token with no code using PowerShell.  Power BI Embedded Playground - https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/ Power BI REST API - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/power-bi/

value.title: How to Create Power BI Account without a Work Email 📧 (Use Gmail/Outlook/Hotmail)
